metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3251 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.41 and prior, 5.7.23and prior and 8.0.12 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.38-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
